intro: Sebastiania chahalana, commonly known as the Chahalana sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces distinctive, fleshy, orange-red berries that are a key feature of its botanical profile. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
